intro: Pholidia woollsiana var. dentata, commonly known as the Woolly Cabbage, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of northern Australia. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The leaves are typically ovate to elliptical in shape and have a rough, textured surface. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by red, fleshy berries. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
